conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway 3D interior: walls show height and thickness with visible side faces and interior volume; ceiling/roof is removed. View is slightly axonometric/elevated rather than a purely flat 2D plan.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D wall extrusion with thickness and readable interior volumes; cutaway is clean. View is only mildly angled (near top-down), limiting perception of verticality compared to stronger isometric.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall zoning matches (2 beds, central living/dining, kitchen/utility area, two baths), but not fully faithful: the small right-side deck/balcony from the 2D plan appears missing or not clearly modeled; some wall offsets/room proportions look simplified compared to the plan. Door/window placements are not consistently represented.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofa seating, dining table) and kitchen counters/appliances indicated; bathrooms have basic fixtures. Some elements are simplified and not all built-ins/utility details match the plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation with distinct walls/floors and good visibility; minimal artifacts. Limited contrast on some openings makes door/window reading weaker.

detected_errors.description: Right-side deck/balcony shown in the 2D plan is not clearly present in the 3D model, indicating a layout fidelity loss.
Door/window openings are not consistently shown or are ambiguous relative to the 2D plan locations and proportions.
Near-top-down camera angle reduces apparent 3D depth compared to a stronger isometric cutaway.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with solid volumetric walls and interiors, but with moderate plan-to-model mismatches (notably a missing/unclear balcony and less faithful opening geometry).
